title: King Charles strips brother Andrew of titles and his mansion
byline: Britain’s King Charles has stripped his younger brother Andrew of his title of prince and forced him out of his Windsor home, Buckingham Palace said on Thursday, seeking to distance the royals from him over his links to the Jeffrey Epstein scandal.

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: Mainly fair weather will prevail in the most parts of the island, today (31), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: GMOA temporarily calls off island-wide strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has temporarily called off the island-wide strike that was scheduled to commence at 8.00 a.m. today (31).

title: Trump sets refugee ceiling at record-low 7,500 with focus on white South Africans
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump set the refugee admissions ceiling at 7,500 for fiscal year 2026, the lowest cap on record, a White House document published on Thursday said, part of a broader effort to reshape refugee policies in the U.S. and worldwide.

title: Suspect arrested over shooting during party in Panadura
byline: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting in which one person was killed and another was injured when two unidentified gunmen who arrived on a motorcycle opened fire with a T56 firearm during a party in the Malamulla area, within the Hirana Police Division.

title: Two firearm magazines found in Jaffna Uni. premises
byline: Two firearm magazines have been discovered within the premises of the University of Jaffna.

title: Sri Lanka Customs revenue surpasses Rs. 2 trillion mark in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has surpassed the Rs. 2 trillion (Rs. 2,000 billion) mark in tax revenue collection for the year, as of last evening (30).

title: Xi to meet Canadian, Japanese leaders after Trump trade truce
byline: China’s Xi Jinping will take centre stage at an annual gathering of Pacific Rim leaders in South Korea on Friday, holding talks with Canadian, Japanese and Thai counterparts after securing a fragile trade truce with U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: 3 close associates of ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ arrested with ‘Ice’ worth over Rs. 35 mln
byline: More information has emerged regarding the seizure of the narcotic substance ‘Ice’ valued at around Rs. 35 million in the Palliyawatta area of the Wattala Police Division.

title: IGP arrives at parliament to discuss MPs’ security
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP), Priyantha Weerasuriya, has arrived at Parliament this morning (31) to discuss the security concerns for Members of Parliament.

title: 4 fishermen rescued after 13 days at sea brought to Hambantota Port
byline: The four fishermen who were rescued after being stranded at sea for 13 days after setting out to sea from Dondra were brought back to the Hambantota Port by the Sri Lanka Navy at around 5 a.m. today (31).

title: Former STC Chairman arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Chairman of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation (STC), Hussain Ahamed Bhaila, has been arrested by officers of Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Rural road development in Sri Lanka backed by USD 90M ADB loan
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has successfully concluded discussions with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to mobilize a loan amounting to USD 90 million under the Second Integrated Road Investment Program (iRoad 2) – Tranche 5.

title: Fire breaks out in transformer at Maradana
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out in an electricity transformer located on Jayantha Weerasekara Mawatha in Maradana.

title: Barcelona’s Sagrada Família becomes world’s tallest church
byline: The Sagrada Família has become the tallest church in the world, after workers placed the first part of a cross at the top of its central tower.

title: Payments via ‘GovPay’ surpass Rs. 750 million
byline: GovPay, a secure and user-friendly online platform designed to facilitate digital payments for Sri Lanka’s government services, has successfully processed over Rs. 750 million in transactions, the Ministry of Digital Economy stated.

title: IGP and Speaker agree to provide security to MPs on request
byline: The Inspector General of Police (IGP) and the Speaker of Parliament have agreed to provide security to all Members of Parliament who request for security personnel, MP Jagath Withana stated.

title: Sri Lanka confirms tourists not required to obtain Electronic Travel Authorisation
byline: Tourists travelling to Sri Lanka are not required to obtain Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) prior to their arrival in the island nation, the authorities said.

title: ‘Conjuring’ prequel movie in the works after ‘Last Rites’ breaks franchise box office records
byline: Audiences haven’t seen the last of paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren, who will return in another “Conjuring” movie.

title: Enter Air launches weekly seasonal flights from Poland to Sri Lanka
byline: With the arrival of winter in the Northern Hemisphere, two planes carrying tourists from Poland arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning (31), marking their inaugural flights.

title: Wellawaya Magistrate suspended from duties
byline: Wellawaya Magistrate Manjula Ratnayake has been suspended from his duties.

title: Ex-President Mahinda’s Chief Security Officer granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of Neville Wanniarachchi, Chief Security Officer to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was arrested and remanded by the Bribery Commission on suspicion of illegally acquiring assets and properties worth Rs. 28 million.

title: Navy seizes dinghy with Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 41 million
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized a dinghy carrying approximately 185kg and 600g of Kerala cannabis and arrested two suspects during a search operation conducted in the Delft sea area off Jaffna.

title: Air Japan to cease operations from March 2026
byline: Air Japan will cease all flight operations from March 2026, almost two years after Japanese airline group ANA launched the brand to offer low-cost flights mainly on Asian routes.

title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite iPhone sales slowdown
byline: Apple’s iPhone sales growth decelerated during its summertime quarter, but the trendsetting company still delivered financial results that exceeded analyst projections while continuing its efforts to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligence race.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: CID seeks extension of detention for arrested female lawyer
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today that it intends to obtain a detention order for a further 90 days for a female lawyer...

title: Kuchchaveli PS Chairman arrested on bribery charges
byline: The Chairman of the Kuchchaveli Pradeshiya Sabha has been arrested on charges of soliciting a bribe of Rs. 500,000, police said.

title: Vatican Foreign Minister Archbishop Gallagher to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, Secretary for Relations with States and International Organizations of the Holy See, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from November 03 to 08, 2025.

title: T-56 assault rifle, 3 grenades also found within Jaffna Uni premises
byline: A T-56 assault rifle, three hand grenades and several rounds of ammunition have been discovered within the premises of the University of Jaffna, hidden in the roof of the university’s library, police said.

title: Shooting incident reported in Kalawana
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in the Delgoda area of Kalawana, resulting in injuries to two individuals.

title: Sri Lankan High Commissioner presents credentials to King Charles III
byline: The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to the United Kingdom, Nimal Senadheera, has officially presented his Letters of Credence to His Majesty King Charles III, according to the Public Diplomacy Division of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: Colombo inflation rises to 2.1% in October 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on a Year-on-Year (Y-o-Y) basis, increased to 2.1% in October 2025, compared to 1.5% in September 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: Hanif Yusoof appointed President’s Special Envoy for Foreign Investment
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof as the President’s Special Envoy for Foreign Investment.

title: Fuel prices revised
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (31).

title: Former STC Chairman granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of the former Chairman of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation (STC), Hussain Ahamed Bhaila, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission on corruption charges.

title: Wife of ‘Backhoe Saman’ granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of notorious underworld figure ‘Backhoe Saman’, who is currently in remand custody.
